summary: Staffing levels at the Office of Federal Student Aid—the largest consumer lender in the country—have not kept pace with its growing student loan portfolio. We found that from FYs 2010-2019 borrowers increased almost 150%, but the office's staff increased 6%. In FY 2020, the office began its first formal workforce assessment and found it was understaffed. As a result, the office didn’t complete about 20%...
title: Higher Education: Office of Federal Student Aid Is Beginning to Identify and Address Its Workforce Needs
